content: quote: Originally posted by SUNLINER81: Why in the "wide wide world of sports", would we back the insurgents?... Doesn't make any sense... Could be captured or stolen weapons... IMHO... Respectfully, SUNLINER81 Sunliner, Agree. After all, they are insurgents, not members of a nation's military in uniform, with issue weapons. The Taliban and other insurgents in Afghanistan, like in Iraq, have weapons from various countries. Not only were those weapons obtained on the battlefield, from stockpiles, etc. but additonally we provided a variety of weapons to the Northern Alliance, to the warlords, and even to al-Qaeda prior to the Taliban assuming power in Afghanistan (at a time when we provided arms to anyone in Afghanistan willing to help throw out the USSR). Surely it should not come as a surprise to the Pakistani military that the insurgents in the Swat Valley and other areas of Pakistan are using some U.S. manufactured weapons. Like the proliferation of Russian AK-47/AK-74's, RPG's, etc.,U.S. manufactured arms are in abundance in that part of the world. Jack

content: Nobody making any bones about all the AK-47s, right? That's just a given. What's an insurget war without AKs everywhere, yet nobody makes any inference about those things as implication of who is causing all the trouble - - By the way, every time they show pictures of HAMAS waving all their AK-47s, you'll always see a few animals waving M-16 types weapons, too. The fact is, both Soviet/Chicom and USA style weapons have been so scattered around the planet that the presence of one or the other just says "Weapons Dealers be getting rich here!!" In fact, both sides often ship in shyyt loads of the other side's weapons to hide who is backing whom, and to cause shallow-thinking masses, prodded by even shallower thinking media, to jump to well-choreographed wrong conclusions - - wheels within wheels . . Wandering and Wondering
